explains: adj. 广义的，普遍的；无显著特点的
v. 推广（generalize 的过去分词）；对……进行概括；使……一般化
wordGroup: generalized system of preferences 普遍优惠制
generalized anxiety disorder 广泛性焦虑，广泛性焦虑障碍

sentences.en: She experienced an increase in generalized aches and pains.
sentences.cn: 她感受到了一种逐渐加剧的全身性疼痛。

sentences.en: These conclusions cannot be generalized to the whole country.
sentences.cn: 这些结论不可能推及全国。

sentences.en: Mood may be defined as a temporary and mild positive or negative feeling that is generalized and not tied to any particular circumstance.
sentences.cn: 情绪可以被定义为一种短暂而温和的积极或消极的感觉，它是泛化的，不受任何特定环境的约束。
